messages.title: The crucial question in this election
messages.content: Who can beat Labour's unpopular MP in Watford?

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposes Conservative stance on NHS, emphasizes Liberal Democrats' commitment to improving healthcare.
Supports smaller class sizes and getting more police on the streets.
Advocates for Liberal Democrats' control of Watford Borough Council and Three Rivers District Council.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Conservative Health Spokesperson Andrew Lansley, Senior Conservative MEP, Conservative Shadow Health Minister
mentions.tacticalSituation: Lib Dems are only 1149 votes away from winning against Labour, referencing historical vote numbers indicating a close race.

issues.economy: References Labour government putting up taxes for ordinary people and bankers avoiding taxes.
issues.education: Advocates for smaller class sizes and more schools.
issues.governance: Mentions Liberal Democrats' control over local government bodies.
issues.health: Discusses NHS funding and new health campus at Watford General Hospital.

housing.content: References to new health campus at Watford General Hospital as part of local development.

leaflet.personalStatement: With your support we can bring change for Watford and make Britain a fairer place to live.

politicalExperience.role: Prospective Member of Parliament for Watford

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet includes a tactical voting appeal, indicating the closeness of the race between Liberal Democrats and Labour, and stressing the potential for the Liberal Democrats to win the constituency from Labour.
